column1: By now, most Americans are beginning to realize that the next phase of the ongoing coronavirus crisis is likely to include severe shortages of food, especially protein. https://www.naturalblaze.com/2020/04/with-looming-food-shortages-new-wyoming-law-bypasses-usda-regulations-to-let-ranchers-sell-meat-directly-to-consumers.html?utm_campaign=Echobox&utm_medium=Social&utm_source=Twitter#Echobox=1588196510

Farmers with excess supplies brought on by the coronavirus lockdown are cutting out the middle man and selling directly to consumers in order to minimize food waste. https://www.naturalblaze.com/2020/04/to-avoid-produce-dumps-some-farmers-started-selling-direct-to-the-public.html?utm_campaign=Echobox&amp

"Now even dogs have to roll over for the coronavirus," reports the NY Post, with the CDC recommending social distancing measures for pets. https://www.activistpost.com/2020/04/even-with-social-distancing-pets-can-be-affected-by-5g-wifi-and-other-sources-of-electrosmog.html?utm_campaign=Echobox&utm_medium=Social&utm_source=Twitter#Echobox=1588198138
